unnormalised: The Delhi govt. has announced some changes to its flagship education scheme, you know, the one everyone's talking about? CM Kejriwal himself said that they're making sure more students get access. Apparently, there was some confusion regarding the eligibility criteria, esp. for students from lower income backgrounds.

unnormalised: The big news is that they've increased the income limit for the scholarship. Earlier it was capped at like, ₹6 lakh per annum family income, but now it's been raised to ₹8 lakh. That's a pretty significant jump, right? A lot more kids can now apply!

unnormalised: Also, there's been talk about expanding the scheme to include vocational training programs. The official notification is expected by 20/07/2024, with the revised guidelines. Supposedly, this will help students who are more inclined towards skill-based jobs after their 10th or 12th std.
